page 600:
"So then I said, if you want to turn me into a prince I have something else you should kiss!" Cabana jokes, grinning at you.


You let out a chuckle, before taking your seat in the Council Room. An Albino business-minded Council Member named Mr Maximov. Strangely, the third figure is a blue-skinned Probiscan in a cheap suit and wearing a translator headset.


"Greetings, Council Members. My name is Alec Maximov, though if you don't know that I'm quite worried that you're leading the free world." Mr Maximov begins.


This elicits a light chuckle from the crowd, which Maximov smiles at.


"It's a pleasure to see you all. I'm here to talk about illegal workers in the Coalition. Look at Freddy, here. He's a Probiscan, obviously. When you see him, you see the enemy of the Coalition. He is not. We have this stone mindset that the Probiscans are communist, that the Thar'Garavan are murderers, the Brain Bugs are monsters and so on. That is not the case. Sure, their governments are, but the people are not. Freddy escaped from the hard Alliance life to work here. He's farmed, hunted, mined and even repaired Coalition ships to feed his family. We are here today to decide what to do with Freddy. Do we embrace him, and every Probiscan, Brain Bug, Antimite, Moogli, Thar'Garavan, Mundar Dweller or anyone else who loves the Coalition and it's values? Or do we cast them out and leave them with nothing? There are hundreds of thousands of immigrants to the Coalition. Just because their race hasn't joined us, they can't join us? Is that what we want? Please, vote to keep the illegal workers, and give them a new home."


Maximov and Freddy the Probiscan sit down. The opposition, another Council Member you vaguely recognize, takes the stand.


"Good evening, members of the Council. I'm here today to oppose Council Member Cabana's proposal. The Council Member would have us replace the common human worker with aliens. These cheap workers are slowly replacing the human worker. They'll walk for a cheap cost, taking jobs from us! We can't be expected to take care of every species! This means we're taking care of the Alliance's working class instead of our own. Not only that, but by accepting these immigrants we'd be blatantly insulting the Alliance and worsen our already terrible relationship. I don't think much more needs to be said. Thank you for listening."


The Council Member nods and walks off. You take out a small, flat tablet, the kind used by Council Members to vote, and immediately the options come up. Do you want to pass the proposal and allow Alliance Immigrants to join the Coalition?

There's some Remnant Nanobot swarms. Finally, there's some squat Mundar holding pick axes and shovels, as well as some tools.


"It's good." You say simply.

page 608:
You sit in your office, a cigar clenched in your teeth, looking over a battle report. There's a lack of morale at the front. The humans believe they're being forced to take most of the losses and are aggressive about it, and the other races believe that the humans are being treated better and are becoming more and more xenophobic.


"Achilles. We have a serious issue." Cabana says as he forces in the door.


"We always have a serious issue."


"This is worse. The alien species want more power, our politicians don't want to give it to them and there's a chunk of other shit going wrong. If this continues, the Alliance will beat the shit into us."


"What's the rundown?"


"There's been race attacks against aliens by humans and vice-versa. The Chosen want their religious texts to feature more prominently in the Coalition laws. The Clones are considering separating from the Coalition. The Remnants want more political power, as most of their entire economy and culture is dedicated to fighting."


"What are our options, Cabana?"


"Well, we could fulfill the demands, but that wouldn't end the many other racial issues. We really only have two options. Firstly, we could use military means to cease power. We'd use soldiers to stop the aliens from uprising and cease power, giving the power to more human-friendly politicians. This would eliminate the issues and put humanity at the top. The Coalition as we know it would fall apart, but humanity would be able to remake it as the new Coalition. It'd sacrifice the unity of all species, but humanity would surive."


"And the other option?"


"I'm not sure this would work, but if you think you have enough reputation among the species, and the Coalition is united enough and loyal to you. We might, and I mean might, be able to reunify the Coalition, but only if the other species are still at least partially united and loyal yo you. Take some time and think about this. The faith of the Coalition is in your hands."

page 504: The Garavan are a divided species. They are made up of many different tribes, including the Thar'Garavan, the Fai'La Tarrn, a tribe that forsakes ground and air vehicles for tamed animals, the Bian Want, a tribe of Garavan who use cyber enhancements to become Cyborg warriors and the Ton Kailisha. The Ton Kailisha are the tribe that's recently gained your attention. Unlike most Garavan Tribes, they've forsaken the concepts of honor, sacrifice and personal glory for success, survival and the sake of the group. This has led the tribe from becoming closer to soldiers than warrior. The Human military attitude has influenced them greatly, and they've began looking up to humans, even replacing the names of their soldiers from Hunter, Honored Warrior and Supreme Hunter to Private, Sergeant and General. They've taken the nickname Tommies, both in honor of the nickname from the army grunts and for easier pronunciation. The Ton Kailisham, or the Tommies, revere humans so much that other Garavan tribes have began targeting them as traitors to their kind. The Tommies have requested that they're allowed to join the Coalition. Though many Tommies have joined the Coalition through the Immigration Department, which is out of your hands, this is the first time the entire Tribe has requested to join, mostly as soldiers, which would count as a mass recruitment, putting the decision in your hands.

You're woken from your sleep by Blaze Goud.


"Sir! We've found an abandoned ship."


"What do I care? Send a Salvage Crew aboard to take what we can, and leave me to my sleep."


"The Ship is of Ancient origins."


You rise slowly out of bed, and quickly shower and get dressed. You make your way to the Command Bridge, where dozens of officers stand by scanners and monitors. 


"What do we know?" You ask, as Blaze lights your ever-present cigar.


"Scans have revealed no signs of life, though their could be abandoned security systems still active." One of the officers says. "Should we send a team on board to investigate?"

page 610:
You decide to pay a visit to the Thar'Garavan homeworld. As the Garavan are a species that value strength, you take Delta-1 and Commando Griffin-Tango, two experienced soldiers. You hop in your shuttle, and head off.


 

The Thar'Garavan's main city, called simply the Fort, is a massive fort built in the middle of lush jungles that the Garavan favor. Dozens of guns and massive worlds surround the city, and you land on a landing pad sitting right outside a massive building where the Great Chief lives.


The doors to your shuttle open, and four tall, muscular Garavan holding massive guns approach. They silently stare at you, before turning and walking towards the Great Chief's home. You follow them, followed by Griffin-Tango, Delta-1 and a dozen Coalition armed guards as well as your own.


"Inhospitable, aren't they, sir?" Commando Griffin-Tango remarks.


"Should worst come to pass, what's the chance we can get out of here in one piece?"


A low, mechanical chuckle comes from Delta-1.


"Sir, I have a Devastator Machine Gun with 15'000 bullets. Unless we're attacked by 15'001 Garavan, we'll survive." Delta-1 replies.


You follow the Thar'Garavan guards into a massive hall. Dozens of Garavan stand on either side watching you. At the end of the hall is a massive throne made of bones from massive creatures, wood and gold. The Great Chief sits in it. The Great Thief is a large Garavan who holds an ornate spear and wearing dozens of metal beads hanging from him. You walk over to him and do the customary bow.


"Greetings, esteemed guests.  I am Great Chief Garavan, descendent of the Hunter and Chief of all Chiefs. I understand you want to talk to me."

page 612:
The Great Chief sits patiently, clearly thinking deeply.


"We have gotten along well, Achilles. I shall fight by your side."


The Chief grabs the end of his spear and quickly slashes open his hand, before holding out the blade. You cut your hand open and well, and the Chief holds out a hand, before pulling it back.


"No offense, Achilles, but actually swapping blood with another species would probably kill one of us. The deal is made. I shall begin sending my warriors and my kin to wherever you need."


You bow again, and another Garavan approaches you. This one is a massive Garavan with dark scales holding two long swords.


"Soft-skin. I am Thar'Kaan, Great Chief Garavan's lieutenant. I have been told me and my men will fight with you."


"You seem strong, Thar'Kaan. It's good to have you on our side." You reply.


"Strong? Whelps are strong. My people say the greatest hunter is Death, who hunts us all. When Death comes for me, I shall kill him and become the greatest. When I lead my forces into the gates of hell I not only survive, I kill the Devil while I'm at it. I'll begin directing my forces to fight the Alliance."


You nod, and after a few minor details are discussed such as troop placement and trading, you make your way back to the shuttle and open a comm link with Mrs Chang.


"Achilles. How did it go?"


"The Garavan will fight with us."


"Good. Well done, Achilles. Make your way back to the fleet."

page 614:
You've spent your entire career working to protect the fleet with  the strongest military the Coalition can muster. You decide to visit Romulus, a small planet where a good cross-section of your military is stationed. You call them up in the communications room, and a hologram of the base commander appears in front of you.


"Good evening, General. It's a pleasure to see you."


"Cut the pleasantries. Are all your forces at the base?"


"Of course, General. With the exception of those out on patrol, of course."


"Perfect. I'll visit you in a week to inspect the troops."


"Of course, General."


You end the transmission, before turning to Blaze, who stands faithfully by you.


"Tell the pilot of my personal ship to begin setting a course to Romulus."


"Now? I thought we were waiting until a week."


"So they can paint over the rust and hide the screw-ups? That's not worth the fuel it would take to get us there. I think it's time for a surprise inspection. Ready the ship."


Within a few hours, you've made it to Romulus and your ship is landing. Your pilot's voice comes over the intercom.


"We are now landing on Romulus. The sites to see are the beautiful sunsets once every six hours, and the confused, surprised Coalition army wondering why the hell you're here so early. I'll tell the Base Commander you've arrived."


The ship lands, and you quickly make your way outside to the docks. A tall, slender black man in full military uniform awaits you.


"General! I'm confused. I thought you were coming next week."


"I decided to come earlier. Shall we see the troops?"


The Commander's face hardens.


"I suppose if you insist. The troops aren't exactly ready for a military parade, but I'll take you to them."


The Commander and you walk into a small train pod, and sit quietly for a few minutes. Soon, you arrive at the base. The base's forces have hastily made their formations, and you watch quietly as they assemble.


"General. Are you ready to see the forces?"


"Of course."


"I'll show you the command squad." The Commander says, nodding.

page 18:

"Good morning, Sir." Murphy says, smiling.


"Good evening, Gentlemen." You reply, pulling out a cigar. "What's the plan for today?"

"Thank you."

page 11: The Clones are a liberal society that has recently emerged. After humanity tried to create a new servant class using DNA to create servants for every role, from leadership to military to medical. Now, they've split from Humanity, making their own fleet with a single Titan Ship. They are an incredibly introverted group, yet they remain close allies of humanity, joining the Coalition.
page 13: You are General Achilles. You come from Greek, American, Russian and Irish descent, mainly Greek, though this can only be found from your DNA, as you were abandoned at a young age. You were named Achilles, after an ancient Greek Warior. You joined the military and were a hero in the War against the Thar'Garavan. You made it home, and reared a family with several kids, who are starting to make families of their own. Now, you've descended into old age, and have been given a spot in the Council.
page 12:
There are several other alien species of note, most of which who have spread to multiple planets through stowing away on ships, or by sentient species purposefully.


Dogs are a furry, carnivorous canine. They are usually genetically and cybernetically by the Coalition to extend their life and be used to fight, and they are also popular as pets.


Red Tortoises are the only known product of inter-planet breeding. They occurred when Tortoises breed with an unknown alien carnivore, creating a red shelled, black skinned, eight-legged tortoise with carnivorous teeth. They are used as pets, to hunt vermin and and to fight.


The Life-Trees are small, partially sentient plants. They are the size of potted plants, and have the intelligence of mice.


Pumi'Garavan are large, dog-like creatures. They have large jaws and tusks, and spines along their back and head. They are used as hunting companions by the Thar'Garavan.


Flurets are large bird-like creatures the size of dogs, used as scouts and hunting companions by the Moogli,


Rock Centipedes are cow sized centipedes used as livestock, pets and guard animals by the Mundar Dwellers.


Fenrir are hedgehog-like creatures the size of dogs, with a pack mentality. They are used as companions and attack animals by the Probiscans.


Walkers are omnivorous, small, humanoid, short-haired mammals with green fur spotted yellow to act as camouflage. They eat seeds, nuts and berries, and have yellow arms and legs with a yellow stalk growing out of the top of their head, topped with a red ball. They communicate through radio-waves, and are nomadic creatures. They have the intelligence of monkeys. Due to their peaceful nature and odd appearance they are seen as good luck charms by most species, and killing them has become taboo.

"Junior! Michael! How are you?" You say, smiling at your son and his partner.

page 22:
You sit on a leather chair. Your security detail stands to your side. In front of you is General Alex-Alpha and Commander Delta-19. General Alex-Alpha is a tall man with short blond hair, and tanned skin. He's the product of Cloning, and through genetics and hard-work has become a General in the United Clone Fleet. 


Commander Delta-19 is a massive Robot, one of the Commanders of the Remnants. He stands at twelve feet, and is humanoid and made of alien alloys you're not familiar with.


"General Achilles! It's a pleasure to see you, my friend!" Alex-Alpha smiles, holding up his palm, a Clone greeting.


"Good Morning, Commander. I hope your sleep cycle was pleasant." Delta-19 says. "I'll get to the point. General Alex-Alpha and his associates want to make strike at the nearby system. It is inhabited by a species of large instectoid aliens. There's a large amount of fossil fuels that we could use. I have pledged the support of the Remnants to act as the heavy troopers. Humanity's military has considerably strength, and your support would help us achieve these goals."


"We require four Leviathan Battleships to conquer the system completely so we can start fuel extraction. We would split the fuel evenly, of course. Do you agree?" General Alpha-Alex asked, raising an eyebrow.

"Ah! Excellent! I'll make the arrangements at once. Did you know my DNA-giver was the Pilot on a ATLAS Fighter? I have a fondness for them." The Clone responds.


"This is good. I fought with humans in the Thar'Garavan War. A Human Commando saved  my life. I promise, I'll take care of your men." The Remnant adds.


"Thank you, gentlemen. I'll send you the Pride of Cork, the Xeno Hunter, the Champion of Earth and the Zeus' Warrior."


"Perfect. We'll leave you to your other arrangements. Thank you, General." General Alex-Alpha smiled, nodded curtly and walked out of the room.


Commander Delta-19 stares directly at you,


"This deal is not very profitable for you. I'm sure there's more profitable ventures you could take. Why are you doing this, may I ask?"


"I'm just helping my friends, Commander."


"Understood. In the future, the Remnants will make sure to help our friends. Goodbye, General."


You both turn, and exit the room.

"Junior! Michael! How are you?" You say, smiling at your son and his partner.

"Farm-raised."


You smile, before sitting down to dinner.
page 20:
You take the transport tube to Mrs Chang's office, and within a few minutes you arrive. Mrs Chang, an old women of nearly 100 years, sits at a counter. She's the most respected member of the council, and one of the best negotiators with aliens you've even seen.


"General Alex-Alpha and Commander Delta-19 wish to see you later. Are you prepared?"


"There's a meeting about a joint military offensive in a nearby system. They want our support."


"Correct. Though it's your choice, I believe you should do it. Though it will sacrifice military resources, we need a stronger alliance with them. It's times like these where we need stronger allies. The Garavan are still bitter after the war and the Alliance are always only looking out for their own needs. We need our allies as strong as can be. The Coalition looks strong, but it's full of fractures. We need to hold it together so it can grow and stay strong. Plus, there's been reports of ships disappearing. Not many, but ships of all creed are disappearing. It's probably nothing, but... who knows?"


"Perhaps." You say, chewing on your cigar. 


"The meetings soon. You should go." Mrs Chang says.


You turn and walk out the door.

The planet is notable for the Moi, a species of blind whales that inhabit Eden-12's massive oceans that have been studied to be incredibly intelligent, possibly close to the intelligence of sentient species like Humans and Probiscans, though they've been quite elusive to studying teams. Humans have even began introducing species of Earth-origins onto Eden-12 that don't interfere with the natural species. The planet has recently been disturbed by a large group of Garavan hunters who hunt down and poach animals to sell and eat. They've been hunting massive amounts of native species, including using depth charges and harpoons to kill massive amounts of Moi. The Coalition Public is appalled by this and many depend military action against the Garavan Poachers. As the planet has little strategic value and is little intrinsic value, protecting the planet would be more of a move to influence voting and gain popularity for the re-election, though this would damage the Coalition's relationship with the Garavan.

"The Moogli culture have a weak concept of civilians, and the Black Hearts have no concept whatsoever. I will not blame them for it. I vote for a full pardon."

The punishment goes from being a possible death sentence to dropping to twenty years, then five years of labor. Eight Pegasus Dropships sit on landing pads with their crew beside them. They salute in unison as you pass.


"These Pegasus ships are a good addition to the army.  They're good for dropping the men into the field to fight, but hell, I wouldn't want to be one of the guys in it. As with the other vehicles, there's no Coalition Dropships, because the aliens wouldn't give them to us. page 122:
"Excuse me, General." A young man who looks like he's fresh out of his teens approaches you.


"Yes?" You ask, turning to face the man.


"My name is Anthony. Anthony Gast. I work with the Hades Project."


"The Hades Project? I'm sorry to say I'm unfamiliar with it."


"The Hades Project is a project established by the top Coalition scientists engineers. Using Ancient technology, we're designing new weapons and technology to be used against the enemies of the Coalition, whoever they may be. We invented the Military Exosuit, the nanobot repair system for said Exosuit, we replaced the Ravager Fighter with the superior Omega model, the ATLAS ship, the Conquistador, and the Odysseus Combat suit, and many other creations. We're quite proud to have caused the new trend of naming technology after Greek myths."


"Alright. What do you need?"


"The Hades Project would like to invite you to see our new project. We've recently designed several new vehicles, and before mass-distribution, we're having a group of three Council Members and five military engineers and generals to see the vehicles, and make the choices on which vehicles the Coalition will use. What do you say?"

"So you'll do it?"


"Yeah. I'll do it."


Several hours later, you sit in a massive vehicle depot, next to three other councilmen. Mr Maximov, who was invited as it's Maximov Industries that will manufacture the vehicles, Admiral Blanger was invited to see the prototypes for the Star Navy and Admiral Nguyen was invited to see the prototypes for the sea-based Navy. In front of several vehicles covered in tarp is Anthony Gast.


"Thank you for coming. I want to introduce you into several prototypes for the Coalition. First, our attempts at a heavy battle tank." Gast says.


Gast pulls off two tarps, revealing two vehicles. The first is a massive, six legged spider-tank. It's main chassis has a dual main gun, mini guns guarding it's flank, as well as a heavy flamethrower and an EMP Gun.


The second is massive version of a tank, and has a massive main gun, several mini guns, an artillery piece, dual flamethrowers and a grenade launcher.


"The first is called the Arachne. It's designed for mobility and endurance, to get the mission done. It was designed by Athena Team. The second is the Hercules, a war machine designed to use fire-power to wipe out the enemy. It was designed by the Gaia Team. You may now vote."

"These creatures have shot civilians. They've shot wounded men. They've shot children. They don't deserve to live. I vote we give them the same fate as they gave our people."

page 367:
"Obviously, we don't have any human dropships, since the Phoenix drop pods are being kept in ships orbiting the planet. I'll show you the other races' dropships."


Several Clone Dropships, which look like Clone Vulture Gunships except with less guns and more passenger space, sit in formation.


"These are the Clone Sparrows. They're good ships, similar to the Vulture's. It's a sturdy, durable and reliable, everything a dropship should be."


Next are several massive dropships, each with four rotors, powerful engines and a massive passenger space for the huge Remnant Marines. 


"These are the Remnant Dropships, the Youtan Models. They're massive ships that are so big I can't understand how they can get in the air. They're named after an airborne predator that the Ancients knew of."


Next there's what looks like the Pegasus Model of Dropship, which you had decided against using. The model has slightly more shielding for the passenger, but otherwise looks the same.


"This is the Tarn drop ship. It's based off a human design. Apparently, because each Tarn Drone isn't a separate life, they're happy to have sacrifice dozens to have them deployed quickly."


Finally there's several massive, boxy vehicle with an anti-grav generator that hover. Six Chosen are stand on either side of the dropship in small alcoves designed for their massive bodies. Large tanks filled with the goo-symbiote that the chosen revere, that operate the ship.


"That's the Bringer of Light, the Chosen Dropship. It's the only vehicle they use for military purposes. It performs well, but personally, the Chosen's whole "goo-worship" deal freaks me out. Anyway, I don't wish to speak badly of one of allies. Let's go."

Democracy is a system of government in which power is vested in the people, who rule either directly or through freely elected representatives. It allows everyday people to make the world a better place for them, and allows everyone to live happily. In theory. In practice, a bunch of politicians frantically kiss babies, which you always found quite creepy, and men suitable for the job are passed over for petty, similar reasons.


As election day nears, you're constantly reminded you need to work on your image. Though it's unlikely you'll be voted out, due to your strong reputation because of your service in the war, and your medals, and your lack of public scandals, you still want to keep up your appearance. You didn't cheat on your wife, or take bribes, or get drunk and kill someone. You'll probably keep your position. 


Still, your publicist wants you to take a few pictures showing your animal loving side, after you recently opened a fund to look after retired military dogs and red tortoises. Your publicist, an elderly black women wearing a white suit named Martha stands in front of you, next to a group of camera drones.


"OK, try smile. Remember, the public want to like you. We have a group of animals. Which do you want to sit with?"

The day you've been dreading has arrived. After the Thar'Garavan war, several atrocities came to light. Thar'Garavan Warriors tortured prisoners for information, butchered civilians and set fire to hospitals. Alliance Soldiers who supported to the Thar'Garavan were found to execute Coalition prisoners. Coalition Soldiers were found to execute prisoners and target Alliance non-war assets. So the leaders of the Alliance, Coalition and Thar'Garavan have finally managed to organize a trial for war criminals. As a soldier in the war and the current Council Member for the Military, your words will have a lot of weight. You sit with the other eleven Council Members, the Remnant Generals, the Clone Generals and the Chosen High-Priests. General Cameron Wake led the Coalition forces in the war. You were his Lieutenant, a roll that normally involves no actual combat, but the ferocity of Thar'Garavan attacks meant everyone, including Wake, picked up a gun and fought. Wake's black hair has turned grey with age, and he's been brought from retirement to stand for his actions.


Supreme Hunter Dart Long-Claw is a Thar'Garavan. As far as Thar'Garavan go, he's a nice enough lizard. He released captured prisoners if they had fought well, and kept the rest rather than killing them. He avoided civilian targets and made a point of fighting on the front lines with the rest of his soldiers.


"General Wake and Supreme Hunter Long-Claw stand accused of treating dead enemy soldiers with disgraceful tactics." Mrs Chang says. "The Thar'Garavan accuse General Wake of feeding the bodies of Thar'Garavan to worms and bugs. General Wake maintains that he was only burying the bodies, as it human tradition. Please vote for what punishments they shall retrieve."
page 359:

"These Pegasus are a good addition to the army.  They're good for dropping the men into the field to fight, but hell, I wouldn't want to be one of the guys in it. We'll need a few more of them if we actually hope to get enough men into the field to win a battle, but we'll make do. As with the other vehicles, there's no Coalition Dropships, because the aliens wouldn't give them to us. page 87:
Cabana makes his way to the center of the room, where a stand has been prepared for him. He gives everyone a godawful, abomination of a smile.


"Members of the Council. The Mundar Dwellers have appealed to us to help them in their civil war. The Mundar Dwellers, to those of you who don't know, are in civil war. While the majority are staying loyal to the Alliance, a group has decided to attempt to leave, and join the Coalition. This turned into a debate, which turned into riots, which turned into a full on civil war. Now is our chance to strike a blow against the Alliance, while gaining a new ally! I propose we give supplies to the rebels and send some light ships to help. Though many have suggested we send our full forces, I believe this would be seen by the Alliance as an act of war, and escalate a full scale war. My main argument is towards General Achilles.He's the leader of the military, and military support is what the Mundar People need. General, we need military support. If we leave these people to fend for themselves, we're condemning them to death. That's something we can't do. They've asked for humanity's help. They've asked for the Coalition's help. Are we strong enough to give it to them?"


You sit there, mulling over the idea. You had many options. You could, of course, leave the Mundar People. There's no real reason to waste human, or Coalition, lives on helping some dirt-digging Alliance members, even if they're rebelling.


Then again, you could do as Cabana wants, and provide support to the rebels. You wouldn't need to commit many men. Give the Mundar some supplies, such as weapons, ammo, food, medicine and equipment, which would help turn the tide of the battle for the rebels. Send some Falcon bombers to damage the loyalist's war efforts. A couple of Special Forces units to eliminate enemy objectives, maybe. That could help the rebels substantially, without incurring the wrath of the Alliance.


Finally, you could fully commit, and launch a full-scale war against the Loyalist Mundar Dwellers. This isn't the time for weak moves done in fear of Alliance Retribution. This is the time for action.

It's made up of a massive fleet, including over half a dozen Titan Ships, hundreds of Behemoth Ships, thousands of Leviathan Battleships and millions of fighters. Three of the Titan Ships, the Zoo, the Deep Blue and the Wild, are filled with wildlife from Earth taken to ensure their survival and can maintain their ecosystems to support the animals, while the others are for humanity's massive population.


There's the hundreds of Behemoth Ships, ships designed to hold smaller populations, as well as to serve a specific purpose to support the fleet, such as farming ships, and to carry supplies, such as water.


Then there's the Fleet Navy, made up of Leviathan Ships, massive battleships used to defend the fleets from other ships. and smaller Ares Frigates to support the Leviathans. The main fighting force are the ATLAS ships, small four-man ships built to serve a multitude of purposes, the Omega Fighters, one-man ships supported by an AI, and Falcon's, planet-to-space bombers that can fight in space and on planets.


Humanity discovered worm-hole travel, allowing FTL travel. They spread quite rapidly, discovering several alien life forms. Humanity entered a short war with the Thar'Garavan Tribe, which ended in negotiations and eventually peace, only a few years ago. They also discovered the Remnants, and the Alliance, and created the Clones.


Humanity has been united as a race, and lines such as Race, Ethnicity and Culture becoming due to inter-marriage between cultures leading to most people being of blended ethnicity and race. The Alliance is an Alliance of many alien races. It is very left-wing by human standards, and the Alliance pushes for equality, though it does prohibit free speech, capitalism and individualism. It includes the following species...


The Creators are a race of bipedal aliens. They are permanently sealed in metal suits, and act as the leaders of the alliance. Little else is known of them.


The Probiscans are a race of bipedal, blue skinned aliens. They have a group of tentacle suckers for a mouth, and make up most of the alliance. They believe in doing things for the group rather than personal gain. 


The Brain Bugs are a race of grey slugs the size of dogs. They are incredible engineers, and have developed massive machines to protect their weak bodies to survive, and make the ships and war machines of the alliance. They care little for things besides their machines.


The Moogli are bipedal, furry aliens who stand at eight feet. They come from an ice world, and are famed for their sniping skills. They are lone animals, and have no society structure, to the point where they don't understand hurting someone they haven't met, and make terrible soldiers.


The Mundar Dwellers are a race of grey-skinned miners. They mainly live underground, and survive by mining and trading resources, and by farming fungus and giant cave-centipedes.


Antimites are elephant-sized, gorilla shaped creatures that stand on all fours. They have no hearing or speech abilities, and communicate through touch by intertwining tongues and flexing them. They are quite slow and peaceful aliens of reasonable intelligence. They are used to carry and wield massive sonic cannons to act as anti-air, anti-tank and anti-infantry.

"The Thar'Garavan Fleet simply arrived, and asked to talk to the Council. The Rak'Ja Tribe, an off-shoot of the Thar'Garavan, followed."


"Where's the fleet?"


"Just past Chandra-3, a massive moon orbiting a gas giant."


"Why do I have to go?"


"You were a soldier. You fought against the Thar'Garavan. A lot of them fought against you personally. They respect you for it."


"Why's Cabana here?" You ask.


Cabana grins.


"I was waiting for one of you to reference me. I've spent some time studying the Thar'Garavan, as well as the smaller Garavan Tribes. Did you know how much incest there is in there culture? But many a time warriors kill over the mistreatment of their daughters by the daughters' new husbands, so the warrior will marry his own daughter after killing her husband. Then there's the religion. Their Main God made the first Garavan women, and impregnated her with a hundred, thousand babies..."

"Despite Mr Cabana and his... terrifying knowledge of Garavan Sex Myths, we need you to go with us to the Thar'Garavan to discuss what they want to discuss."

"Of course."

"Members of the Council. The Mundar Dwellers have appealed to us to help them in their civil war. The Mundar Dwellers, to those of you who don't know, are in civil war. This turned into a debate, which turned into riots, which turned into a full on civil war. Now is our chance to strike a blow against the Alliance, while gaining a new ally! I propose we give supplies to the rebels and send some light ships to help. Are we strong enough to give it to them?"

page 640:
The final campaign is going well. After the Iron Ring fell, the Alliance are clearly going to be destroyed soon. Unfortunately, several Coalition plans have fallen into Alliance hands. Mrs Chang has called you to her chambers to discuss the reason.


You walk into Mrs Chang's office, and take a seat. Mrs Chang stares at you silently for a minute.


"We have a problem."


"If I had a soldier every time I heard that the Alliance would be burning."


"The spy. The one who gave our plans to the Alliance, and who allowed the assassination team onto the ship to kill you..."


Your robotic arm whirrs in reminder of that.


"... has possibly been found."


"Who is it?" You reply as calmly as you can.


"We've found one of the council members has been receiving illegal funds through his accounts, and definitely has the ability to do this. They've worked with the Alliance so they could have easily been radicalized to hate the Coalition. There's also considerable other evidence, but that's only documents and trip times. We're pretty sure, but not certain, it's him."


"Give me a name, Chang, and I'll give you the bastard's body." You say. 


This bastard betrayed the Coalition, and let the men who were going to murder you, your wife and your children in your sleep. You're going to have your revenge.


"It's Augustus Cabana."


You stop. Cabana's been one of your closest friend since the start of your career. It can't be him... Can it?"


"I'll deal with it." You say simply, before walking off.

page 642:
You take your bodyguards and a shuttle, and head to the Iron Ring's main planet, known as the Ruby. You watch as the planet's anti-air and anti-space guns focus on your shuttle, but true to the Leader of the Iron Ring's word, they don't fire. Your shuttle lands next to a massive, heavily armored building. The shuttle door opens, and a mixed-race group of Alliance soldiers escort you into the building. You look at the condition of your escort. The Alliance soldiers are clearly in terrible conditions, and some show obvious, untreated wounds. You're led into a small room, where the Leader of the Iron Ring sits in a wooden chair. The Creator wears a massive metal space suit, blocking the Creator's face and body.


"Good evening, General. I assume you're here to report your unconditional surrender." The Creator makes an odd noise, which his translator turns into a laugh.


"Leader of the Iron Ring? Is that your name or your title? I'm not familiar with how Creator names work."


"It's a name for your to speak. You wouldn't be able to say or even completely hear my real name."


"Well, we're here to ask for your surrender. My men will take the Iron Ring. The only question is how many graves will be left on this planet afterwards."


The Creator slowly nods.


"I understand. My men are tired. We had greatly underestimated the Coalition's strength. Not only have you maintained and are currently winning the main front, you've managed to launch several attacks from directly behind Alliance space."


You have no idea what he's talking about, but you decide to let him continue.


"I want the Iron Ring to survive more than I want anything else. My ancestors founded it. It's as much part of me as my blood. I understand, should we surrender, that's you'll take or destroy our offensive weapons. I have only one condition of my surrender: Leave the defenses, the concrete walls, the shields, etc. I can't let the Iron Ring be completely destroyed.
page 520:
Chapter Two: The Brink of War


"General. You and me are being sent to the Alliance world of... I'm pretty sure the human tongue can't pronounce the name. We're calling it AY-17."


"Why are we going?"


"We're being sent as a diplomacy group to the Alliance festival of unity, along with Tarn, a few Remnant Generals, a few Clones and a few Chosen. We're going to land, take a few pictures, make subtle threats and other political stuff. Make sure to brag about how impressive our military is."


"Is it completely necessary that I go?"


"Well, technically you can refuse, but that'd... that'd screw up a lot of things."

page 664:
You stand in front of a massive crowd, watching the audience. You're in the Alliance capital, accepting the surrender of the Creator leader, known as the Great Commander. Mrs Chang stands to your right, Cabana to your left. The Great Commander walks up to you, bows his head, and offers you a metal gauntlet, the Creator's way of surrendering.


"General Achilles, the Alliance is yours. I officially surrender on behalf of all the people in the Alliance."


"I accept your surrender." You reply.


You quickly glance around. You're standing on a podium in front of a crowd of all different species. The stage is filled with the Alliance leaders, as well as the Coalition leaders, who are mostly human after humanity took over the Coalition through military means and enforcing their control. You step up to the podium to make your victory speech.


"Humans are survivors. We are soldiers. We are leaders. We are conquerors. We've survived lava spewing from the Earth, massive tidal waves, wars, missiles that could obliterate the entire Earth. Not only did we survive, but we prospered. Mankind not only went into space, we conquered it. We founded a Coalition and conquered every other goddamn alien there is. Mankind will survive anything that's thrown at us. We will not only survive the apocalypse, we are the apocalypse. This is only the first stage of mankind's victory. Soon, the whole universe will fall before us. Mankind is strong. This is Mankind's Conquest."


The audience, or at least the vast human part of it, break out into applause. Mrs Chang smiles at you, and Cabana takes you aside.


"Well Achilles, we did it. We don't have to fight any more blue-skins, or deal with espionage, or anything like that. You have celebrations to deal with and whiny Alliance leaders to console. But when you finish, come have a drink with me." Cabana says, giving you his trademark grin that causes his disgusting face to distort and bleed, which you've come to find as charming.


Cabana smiles and turns to walk off. As he walks off, the Great Commander walks over to you. He puts his arm over your shoulder in a vague attempt to act human, and begins walking with you.


"General, we unofficially surrendered three weeks ago. Now, we've officially surrendered. Will you finally call off your constant attacks?" The Great Commander says.


"I haven't authorized any attacks for three weeks, Great Commander."


"General, I've lost entire worlds in the past three weeks. It's from the army that you sent to flank us, to attack our worlds from behind."


You pause.


"I've sent no such army. Speaking of such, I haven't had the army that you sent to flank us surrender yet."


The Great Commander stares at you.


"General Achilles, my forces were more than enough to match yours on the main front. The reason the Alliance lost this war was because of the massive army you've sent from the newest front."


"I've done no such thing, General. The Coalition has sent no massive army to attack your flank, and judging my your tone, you haven't sent an army to flank me."


The Great Commander sighs.


"We have a problem."

page 302:
More issues with the Coalition and Alliance are happening. Several outbreaks have occurred where Alliance soldiers and ships have engaged Coalition forces and vice-versa, though the politicians are quick to clear these up as "mistakes". You let out a small smile when you realize you're one of those politicians. Though neither you nor the Alliance have officially declared war, most people understand it's only a matter of time. Citizens are stocking up on food, which you find humorous as the fleet is completely self-sufficient, making such actions futile. The Hades Project has started to distribute the vehicles that you ordered. The only thing now is to prepare for war as best you can.


The first thing that needs to be dealt with is the Eagle Assault Drones. They're small orbs the size of basketballs with antigravity generators, an assortment of tools, a machine gun and an AI Core. They're used for surveillance, support and assaulting enemy locations. The Hades Project has proposed the Helios Assault Drones, which would replace the Eagle Assault Drones. The Helios Drones have better communications systems, armor, battery life, a more advanced AI, the blowtorch has been replaced by a laser torch and the Helios model has many more advanced features. The Hades Project has said with increased funding, and use of the Eagle Assault Drones to rewire and test. page 668:
You stand in front of a massive crowd, watching the audience. You're in the Alliance capital, accepting the uniting of the Coalition and Alliance. You're representing the Coalition, and the Creator leader known as the Great Commander is representing the Alliance. Mrs Chang stands to your right with Tarn and Prophet Mut. To your left are Cabana, Delta-1 and Alex-Alpha. The Great Commander walks up to you, and offers you his hand. Thankfully, he's following human tradition, so you grasp his hand and shake vigorously.


"General Achilles, the Alliance is no more. Now, we will form the New Coalition."


"The New Coalition will be bigger, stronger and will last a thousand times longer." You reply.


You quickly glance around. You're standing on a podium in front of a crowd of all different species. The stage is filled with the Alliance leaders, as well as the Coalition leaders. You step up to the podium to make your speech.


"The Coalition is strong. We are unified in the beliefs that everyone has a right to vote, a right to life, and a right to freedom. We are a Coalition of heroes. Humanity has sent wave after wave of soldiers to fight and die to get where we are. Clones have lose countless men just to weaken the Alliance, so we could get here. The Remnants have sent ships and soldiers into hell itself to get where we are. Tarn died countless times as his bodies were painfully killed so we could get here. The Chosen have saved countless lives to make getting here easier. We have taken loss after loss to get here. We've made sacrifice after sacrifice, to get here. But we did. We got here. The Coalition has survived and prospered. We made it, gentlemen. This is the victory of the Coalition."


The audience break out into applause. Mrs Chang smiles at you, and Delta-1 salutes you. Tarn gives a friendly nod, and Alex-Alpha grins at you. On the Alliance side, the Moogli Commissar waves, the Probiscan Enlightened One nods at you, the Antimite Monarch stares at you slowly and the Brain Bug Admiral wiggles to tentacles at you. You step down from the podium, and Cabana takes you aside.


"We did it, Achilles. And through peace, none the less. I never though peace was your thing, but hey, there's less death. When you finish talking over peace terms with the aliens, come find me. We'll share a drink."


Cabana walks away the Great Commander walks over to you. He puts his arm over your shoulder in a vague attempt to act human, and begins walking with you.


"General, we made peace three weeks ago. Now, we've officially formed and made the new Coalition. Will you finally call off your constant attacks?" The Great Commander says.


"I haven't authorized any attacks for three weeks, Great Commander."


"General, I've lost entire worlds in the past three weeks. It's from the army that you sent to flank us, to attack our worlds from behind."


You pause.


"I've sent no such army. Speaking of such, I haven't had the army that you sent to flank us surrender yet."


The Great Commander stares at you.


"General Achilles, my forces were more than enough to match yours on the main front. The reason the Alliance lost this war was because of the massive army you've sent from the newest front."


"I've done no such thing, General. The Coalition has sent no massive army to attack your flank, and judging my your tone, you haven't sent an army to flank me."


The Great Commander sighs.


"We have a problem."

While repairing the drone, Mikhael began planning the rest of his day. He needed to make dinner, pick up his kid from school, check...


Mikhael heard a massive rumbling from the sky. In the sky, slowly approaching, were two massive spherical orbs. Hundreds of ships were being sent out of the orbs, and heading towards the surface. Mikhael yelped as one of these ships quickly flew towards his farmhouse, and landed with a soft thud into the soft soil. Mikhael slowly approached the ship. Suddenly, the ship's doors opened, and a group of six, insectoid cyborgs slowly walked out. Mikhael slowly raised his hands in surrender. He saw in the sky several more orbs were approaching, each carrying a massive army of destruction. He looked back at the insectoid cyborgs, waiting for them to take him prisoner. "Those are the Chosen Healers. Though their constant prayers to the symbiote get tiring, they've saved a lot of lives."


Next are the Tarn Medics, who wear body armor, and hold a small medical kit and a shotgun. Because all Tarn share the same consciousness, they'll happily execute injured Tarn Drone if it's too hard to save them, as it's not actually killing something.


Next are the Remnant Medics, but you feel medics isn't the right word. Each one is actually a swarm of tens of thousands of nanobots, each swarm controlled by a Hive Mind.

page 443:
The medics all stand at salute. They're wearing heavy powered armor painted white with red trim and decorated with several Red Crosses to show that they're non-combatants and medics. One arm of the armor has several syringes on the arm that can be used to inject various medicines and stimulants into the wounded and dying. The medics wear backpacks containing various bits of medical supplies and medicines. Their equipment looks far beyond what you've seen before, and you turn to the commander.


"These are the medics, wearing the newest medical suit, the Asclepius model. They're able to save nearly anybody given the time from any wounds, and they're able to survive fire from any assholes who decide medics make fair game in war. They're good men willing to die for the greater good."


Next to the human medics are the Clone Medics, who look quite similar to the human medics except in smaller number. 


Next are the Chosen Healers. They have massive syringes attached to one arm that are used to pump medicine into patients. They have to slings on their backs which act like hammocks to carry wounded men. 


"Those are the Chosen Healers. Though their constant prayers to the symbiote get tiring, they've saved a lot of lives."


Next are the Tarn Medics, who wear body armor, and hold a small medical kit and a shotgun. Because all Tarn share the same consciousness, they'll happily execute injured Tarn Drone if it's too hard to save them, as it's not actually killing something.


Next are the Remnant Medics, but you feel medics isn't the right word. Each one is actually a swarm of tens of thousands of nanobots, each swarm controlled by a Hive Mind. 


"Those are the Remnant Nanobot Swarms. They're capable of stripping destroyed vehicles and using the materials to repair the Remnant soldiers. Thankfully, they're not used to fight. A swarm of those could strip your flesh from the bone."
page 564: "You do not understand. This vehicle is not the Alliance's. It is mine, and I shall die with it. I have made it a weapon so it will survive. No longer will my species require larger creatures acting as our hosts to protect ourselves. I am my own protection."
page 685:
A dozen Zeus Gunships sit on several landing pads, with their pilots, engineers and gunners alongside them. 


"These are our Zeus Gunships. They have enough firepower to take out an entire army. We even have enough ammunition to keep these things working. As with the other vehicles, we don't have any Gunships from the other Coalition races. Let's go on." Commander Shepard says, continuing walking.
page 204:
It's time to see the war council that's being formed with you at the head. You walk into the War Room of the Leviathan Battleship named the Hellstorm. Sitting, or floating, at far left is a small metal drone with a single blue eye. It introduces itself.


"Hello, General. I am Admiral Kane-44. I am head of the Coalition Star Navy. Of course, this is only a small part of my body to help me interact. I am actually a massive warship floating a great distance away. It's a pleasure to meet you."


Next is a grey haired, elderly Clone who quickly rises and shakes your hand.


"Commando Griffin-Tango, Sir. I'm in charge of Coalition special forces, Sir."


Next is Tarn, or a Tarn Drone.


"Hello again, General. I am a Military Advisor, due to my countless years of experiance."


Next is a large Chosen, who stares at you.


"I am Kayn the Lesser. I am in charge of the Medics."


Next is a Human with a balding head and a wrinkled, scarred face.


"Greetings, General. I am General Farley, head of the Coalition Army. The grunt army, rather than all Coalition Armed Forces, which is, of course, your position."


Next is a massive Remnant Soldier, painted dark red and black.


"I am Delta-1, General. I'm head of the Marines. I can't wait to kill some xenos."


Next is another Human, a tall, slender, black-haired man smoking a cigarette. 


"I'm General Maximov, of the Air Force."


Finally, there's another Clone.


"I'm Admiral Kevin-Tango, Sir, of the sea-based Navy."


These are you lieutenants and the heads of the Coalition Military under you. You're ready to do some work, but that starts tommorow. For now, you need to head to bed. You excuse yourself and walk off.

You walk over to the Probiscan Stages, and stop at one. Four Probiscans wearing a massive monster costume walks around while dozens of Probiscans dance around it. The Probiscans begin firing fake laser rifles at the monster, as the monster begins killing Probiscans one by one.


"Excuse me, what's going on?" You ask a Probiscan, after turning your translator on.


"Oh. A Human. Greetings. I hope you enjoy the world. This is a play about the brave 1st Regiment fighting against a massive, Alpha Tene Mal, a creature from the Garavan Homeworld. It's a true story."


You watch as half of the Probiscans are killed, before the tallest Probiscan dances to the front of the Tene Mal, and shoots it in the face. The Tene Mal collapses, falling to the ground. The Probiscan audience begin holding their fists in the air in what you assume is an alien version of applause. The Tall Probiscan hops off the stage and is handed a translator, which he clips around his mouth, before walking up to you.


"Greetings, Esteemed Coalition Leader. Please, tell the us what you thought of the play."

Two dozen Prometheus vehicles sit in formation with their crew beside them. They salute in unison as you pass.


"These Prometheus vehicles are a great addition to the army. We have enough to do considerable damage, thank God. They're great machines. The Prometheus can cross many types of terrain and has an incredibly high success rate at traveling."


Next to the Prometheus vehicles are a large four wheeled light vehicle with a large main cannon, and two flank machine guns.


"Those are the Clone vehicles, the Champions. They're good for anti-vehicle, so they can really supplement our Prometheus's." 


Next to the Champions are four legged turrets with a main machine gun, a heavy cannon and a laser cannon.


"These are the Hyena's. They might look slow, but I've seen these things run faster than a cheetah and jump over blockades."


Next are the Tarn Vehicles. They look like larger versions of quad bikes, with a driver's seat and a minigun on the back.


"Those are the Tarn Vehicles. They move in perfect unison, ambushing enemy squads, fighting with better unity than anyone else could. Though I'm not sure if it's unity if they're all the same... thing. That's all of the light vehicles. Let's continue."

page 673:
Mikhael sat in an open field, working on the farming drone. The drone had been hit by a streak of lightning, frying it's circuits. It would be a quick, but expensive repair. While repairing the drone, Mikhael began planning the rest of his day. He needed to make dinner, pick up his kid from school, check...


Mikhael heard a massive rumbling from the sky. In the sky, slowly approaching, were two massive spherical orbs. Hundreds of ships were being sent out of the orbs, and heading towards the surface. Mikhael yelped as one of these ships quickly flew towards his farmhouse, and landed with a soft thud into the soft soil. Mikhael slowly approached the ship. Suddenly, the ship's doors opened, and a group of six, insectoid cyborgs slowly walked out. Mikhael slowly raised his hands in surrender. He saw in the sky several more orbs were approaching, each carrying a massive army of destruction. He looked back at the insectoid cyborgs, waiting for them to take him prisoner. Suddenly, they fired, and Mikhael was no more. The End had arrived.

page 560:
You sit and wait patiently as the shuttle dives towards the planet. After some minor turbulence, the shuttle lands and the doors open. A group of five Creators stand waiting, with over a dozen armed Probiscan guards on either side of them.


"Greetings, Coalition leaders. Please, come with me."


You stand and follow the Engineers as they quickly lead you out of the building and outside, where a massive festival takes place.


A Creator points to the festival. Groups of Probiscans crowd around performing dances, flute songs and plays.


"These are our Probiscan allies. They are strong and healthy, and numerous in numbers."


The Creators point to a large group of Brain Bugs in large war machines and ships.


"These are our Brain Bugs, showcasing their personal, customized vehicles which are incredibly efficient, numerous and strong."


"Excuse me, do we really need to hear how great everything is? I don't even need a tour. I'd just like to see the festival in my own time." Cabana says.


"Of course. Please, take your time to explore." The Creator replies, clearly dissatisfied.

page 101:
A week later, you sit in the bar, next to Mrs Chang and Gus Cabana.


"What do the scaly, cold-blooded monsters want?" You ask.


Mrs Chang sighs, and stares at you.


"The Thar'Garavan Fleet simply arrived, and asked to talk to the Council. The Rak'Ja Tribe, an off-shoot of the Thar'Garavan, followed."


"Where's the fleet?"


"Just past Chandra-3, a massive moon orbiting a gas giant."


"Why do I have to go?"


"You were a soldier. You fought against the Thar'Garavan. A lot of them fought against you personally. They respect you for it."


"Why's Cabana here?" You ask.


Cabana grins.


"I was waiting for one of you to reference me. I've spent some time studying the Thar'Garavan, as well as the smaller Garavan Tribes. Did you know how much incest there is in there culture? Like if a warrior kills another warrior, he kills his kids unless they're old enough to be taken as wives. But many a time warriors kill over the mistreatment of their daughters by the daughters' new husbands, so the warrior will marry his own daughter after killing her husband. Then there's the religion. Their Main God made the first Garavan women, and impregnated her with a hundred, thousand babies..."


"Cabana. Please." Mrs Chang says, looking uneasy.


Cabana holds up two webbed hands in defense.


"Hey, I'm just telling Achilles what I know. I even avoided talking about how the Garavan dogs came about. Which has so much weird sex stuff. Please, ask me how the dogs came about. I'll give you a hint: It involves a trickster god, a net and this weird sex toy that..."


"Gus, shut the hell up." You say.


"Despite Mr Cabana and his... terrifying knowledge of Garavan Sex Myths, we need you to go with us to the Thar'Garavan to discuss what they want to discuss."


"I'll go, then. But you're making sure there's at least two bottles of expensive Scotch on the shuttle. Make that three bottles."


"Of course."
page 222:
"We're keeping the ship, Lesser Chief Dom. We're not letting you taking it."

page 343:
Two dozen Valkyries hover in formation with their crew beside them. They salute in unison as you pass.


"These Valkyries are a good addition to the army.  They can hover over any terrain easily, and the boys are finally getting used to them."


Next to the Valkyries. tanks are a large four wheeled light vehicle with a large main cannon, and two flank machine guns.


"Those are the Clone vehicles, the Champions. They're good for anti-vehicle, just like our Centimines."


Next to the Champions are four legged turrets with a main machine gun, a heavy cannon and a laser cannon.


"These are the Hyena's. They might look slow, but I've seen these things run faster than a cheetah and jump over blockades."


Next to the Hyena's are a four wheeled jeep with a large machine gun on top, a well as a dual flamethrower. Mundar Drivers, Gunners and Engineers stand alongside.


"Those are the Grawlers. I think that's how it's pronounced. The Mundar use them to support their troops."


Next are the Tarn Vehicles. They look like larger versions of quad bikes, with a driver's seat and a minigun on the back.


"Those are the Tarn Vehicles. They move in perfect unison, ambushing enemy squads, fighting with better unity than anyone else could. Though I'm not sure if it's unity if they're all the same... thing. That's all of the light vehicles. Let's continue."

"Greetings, Council Members. I am Tarn, as I hope you would know." One of the Drones says, stepping forward. "It's a pleasure to see you. Shall I escort you to the dining room?"


Mrs Chang steps forward and smiles.


"It a pleasure to be here. We would love to go to the dining room."


You're led along the hallways by the Tarn Drones. One of them turns to you.


"Greetings, General. It's a pleasure to see you again."


"Hello, Tarn."


"I remember I had a dozen bodies under your command against ten times as many Thar'Garavan. I was sure we'd all get massacred, but I only lost two bodies, and the Thar'Garavan were crushed. I'm glad to be on your side. You'd be a fearsome enemy, General."


"If we were to talk about fearsome enemies, I think you'd be the worst person to have as an enemy. You've lived for millions of years and have countless drones under your command."


"True. But, I'm forgiving and kind. I saw you beat a Garavan assassin to death. You're scary man. Ah, we're here."


Two doors slide open, revealing several large dining tables with various species.


"Council Members, feel free to take a seat. page 100:
You sit in the lounge of the Dionysus Ship you're traveling in, drinking a bottle of Scotch. Cabana walks in, holding a strange, serrated metal bottle.


"Thar'Garavan Rum. I tell you, you could never get drunker on anything else."


Cabana sits down next to you, and gives you one of his horrific smiles.


"Jesus, Achilles. You're a politician. Surely you could at least hide your disgust at my appearance."


"Sorry, Mr Cabana."


"Please. Call me Gus. Mr Cabana was... well, not my father. My father was a bug, like hyper-evolved diarrhea. I believe Mr Cabana was my mother's father. Anyway, thank you for supporting the Mundar Dwellers. I put a lot of my reputation on the line that you'd support this. Still, those Rebels better join the Coalition. My fiance going to have my head otherwise."


"You're engaged?" You ask, curiously.


"Yeah, to my childhood sweetheart. I met her in high school, back when I was just the nerd who loved math, comics and whose dad was a parasitic alien. Still sometimes I worry that she doesn't really love me, and she's only with me for my looks."


Gus chuckles, before taking a long drink of Thar'Garavan Rum.


"God that's delicious. Do you want a sip?"


"I'm happy with human beverages, thank you."


"That's a Clone brand of Scotch."


"Screw it, it's close enough."


The Pilot's voice comes over the intercom.


"We are descending on Marr. Air levels are not enough to sustain human life, so make sure to stay inside at all times, where Oxygen can be pumped."


You continue sipping your scotch as the ship begins traveling through the atmosphere. After a while, you've managed to successfully to dock. Gus stands up and walks to the docking station, where Mrs Chang waits.


"Remember, the Mundar Rebels should be treated incredibly differently to the Loyalists. The Rebels prize commerce to an extreme. The majority of the rebels were business or trade orientated before the civil war, so make sure to talk how many trade advantages there are in the Coalition. Also, do not call them Rebels. Call them Revolutionaries. Understood?"


"Of course." Gus replies.


The door opens, and you walk out. Mundar Dwellers stand on either side, Rebels on the left and Loyalists on the right. You stare directly the Mundar Dweller on your left. He, or possibly she, is about four and a half feet tall,large and muscular with deathly pale, thick skin, and he, or she, has a set of teeth quite similar to a human. He, or she, has tiny eyes, large flat ears and a massive nose. The Rebel pats a fist against his red armored breastplate, which you assume is a Mundar Dweller gesture.


"Achilles, let's go." Cabana says, patting you on the shoulder. 


You walk along the hallway, which is little more than a tunnel through rock. You walk for a few minutes, before arriving into a large conference room. Three massive robotic Generals from the Remnants stand at the head of the table, next to two identical-looking men with salt and pepper hair, a single Tarn Drone and two giant aliens wearing what looks like ancient diving suits that were filled with a symbiotic goo. You take your seat with them, the Coalition's representatives. At a right angle to you are the Rebels, who sit at the head of one of the tables. There's over twenty of them, all wearing some form of Armour or clothes painted or dyed bright red. Across from you are the Alliance Representatives, five Creators wearing metal space suits and staring around the room, as well as a Probiscan Enlightened One, a Moogli Commissar, a Brain Bug Admiral and an Antimite Monarch. At the other end of the table are the Loyalists, who are represented by a single man, the Chief, due to their communist nature.


General White-Eye stands up, and raises a fist. You put on your headset, and White-Eye lets out a series of unintelligible grunts.


"Greetings, Esteemed Leaders of the Sentient Beings of the Galaxy." Your headset translates. "I would like to thank you all for coming here to discuss our newfound independence from the Alliance."


"Is that completely necessary? There could be a lot done to make your membership to the Alliance more beneficial." A Creator says.


"Let the General talk." A Remnants' General says.


"My colleagues and I believe that the Mundar Dwellers should stand on our own. The Chief disagrees, so our people tried to *WORD UNTRANSLATABLE*."


The Chief paused, looking for the right words.


"So our people tried to... express their freedom. But these fights are a case of breaking the pick instead of the stone, as the old saying goes. So I would like to discuss our leaving the Alliance."


The Probiscan Enlightened One stands up abruptly, and lets out a high pitched whistle, which you remember is the way Probiscans communicate.


"Why is the Coalition here? This is no place for them!" Your translator emits.


"If we leave the Alliance, we will join the Coalition." The General White-Eye says, before looking at you. "If the Coalition will let us join, of course."


"It would be a pleasure to have the Mundar Dwellers join the Coalition." Mrs Chang says.


"I lead the Mundar Dwellers, and I say we stare with the Alliance!" Chief Rock-Foot yells.


"In the interest of using simpler terms, I would ask that the... revolutionaries are known as the..." Mrs Chang said.


"Free Mundar Republic." General White-Eye said.


"And the loyalists be known as the United Mundar Dwellers."


"The Council Member makes a fair point." One of the Creators said.


"We'll use your *WORD UNTRANSLATABLE*, then." Chief Rock-Foot says, before letting out a yell and smashing his foot against the stone floor. "Names! We'll use your names! These translators are cheap and ineffective."


One of the Remnants Generals, a massive, scarred machine, stands.


"There are bodies covering this planet." He says loudly.  "There are bodies of Mundar soldiers spread among the battlefields of this Civil War. There is no re-uniting of the Mundar Dwellers. The United Mundar Dwellers can allow the Free Mundar Republic to leave, and spend the rest of today discussing planetary borders and discuss the nuts and bolts of this system. If this civil war continues, I'll be pledging the full military support of the Remnants. I'd like to think the rest of the Coalition would follow me. The Alliance will follow suit, and there'll be a lot more bodies on a lot more battlegrounds. What's your choice, Chief Rock-Foot?"


Rock-Foot paused. There was silence for what seemed like hours, before Rock-Foot nodded.


"With the help of the great Alliance, we could easily repel and even crush the Coalition. But I refuse to sacrifice even a single true, loyal Mundar life to do so. Go run to the Coalition. Take your traitor, scum-sucking world of maggots and go abandon the Alliance that fed and clothed you."


"Gladly." General White-Eye says, before mockingly patting his fist against his breastplate. "Shall we discuss what you define as a "traitor, scum-sucking world of maggots"?"


You grin, and settle down to begin discussing the details of the Free Mundar Republic's newfound independence. Now, Humanity has a new ally to make it all the more stronger, and the Coalition has a new member race.

You continue going through the cases in a similar fashion. You feel no remorse for the cold monsters who committed atrocities in the war, no matter what the side. Of note is a large group of Thar'Garavan executed for torture, a Clone commando who planted explosives in Thar'Garavan medical stations, a human sergeant who had executed dozens of surrendering soldiers.


What does get you, however, are the special cases. There's a lot of issues with fighting another species. It's the guys who've made mistakes and are filled with guilt and remorse that really reminds you of the harsh realities of war. There's a group of human soldiers who opened fire on a group of small, toothy Garavan, assuming they were a Garavan subspecies only to find they were actually children. Another group wiped out a group of Thar'Garavan who were surrendering, confusing their raising their swords, a Garavan tradition that surrendering warriors would take, as the Thar'Garavan preparing to charge. A Probiscan chef poisoned dozens of Coalition prisoners by forgetting what substances were poisonous to them. All of these were good, innocent people who made a mistake, and now have to suffer for it, both from the punishments they receive and the guilt they'll suffer. Still you make your way through the trial and when it ends, you leave and go back to working with the military.

page 216:
"Thank you for voting. We only have one more military archetype for the army, the dropship. We need a reliable model to drop our marines and vehicles into battle from orbiting spaceships, to replace the former model. We have the Pegasus, made by Team Perseus, the Phoenix, made by Team Athena, and Icarus, made by Team Icarus, the most narcissistic team for naming their vehicle after themselves,"


Gast removes three tarps. The first vehicle, the Pegasus, is a large ship. It has several dozen seats and straps on either side, and in the center a space for vehicles to be attached and dropped.


"The Pegasus is designed for speed and fast deployment. The infantry and vehicles can be gotten into battle incredibly quickly and have them deployed within a few seconds. This does come at the cost of armor, and means the that enemy fire can kill the troopers being carried, destroyed the vehicles being carried and can even take down the ship, though it does minimize the time is it in battle."


The second vehicle isn't so much as a dropship, as a drop pod. The small, arrow shaped pod has enough space for a small vehicle, or a dozen marines.


"The Phoenix is designed to be fired from an orbiting space ship, to drop infantry and light vehicles from space onto the battlefield. It's quick and the ship is incredibly hard to be stropped by enemy anti-air fire, though it is known to malfunction. It's also incapable of getting back to the ships. " 


The third vehicle is a large dropship. At the back is a large carriage capable of holding two vehicles and a substantial amount of infantry, while at the front is the cockpit, as well as two gunner positions with large machine guns to defend the dropship.


"The Icarus is designed for endurance and strength. It can defend it's passengers with it's weapons while they're deployed, at the cost of a longer deployment time, meaning the dropship is under enemy fire for longer. You may now vote."
page 458: The Tarn, or Tarn, are an interesting race. They're humanoid, and have massive mouths, with giant giants filled with rows of long teeth, as well as four tusks, two descending from the upper jaw and two rising from the bottom. They have tough, bone-coloured skin. What's interesting about them isn't their appearance, it's what they are. The Tarn are a hive-mind, with ever single member part of a single consciousness. They have no individuality and act in unison, referring to themselves as one person with many bodies. Despite this unnerving behavior, they, or it, or he, is quite friendly, if not socially awkward due to the fact the Tarn has lived for thousands of years without meeting another consciousness. They've been a loyal ally of humanity since their discovery.

page 218:
After a few minutes, the boarding party finally land. They attach breather mask and scuba gear to survive into the ship, and quickly breach the hull. Water floods out, but the boarding party block the leak and disappear into the ship. You look to a monitor and watch through a helmet-mounted camera as the boarding party make their way through the ship.


The inside of the ship is a battleground. Dead Sciartt float, harpoons and shrapnel piercing their bodies. Still, those aren't the only bodies you spot. Dead Garavan, wearing breather masks, float nearby.


"Head to the bridge." Your say.


You watch as the boarding party head to the bridge. Here, there are dozens of corpses floating around in the water that fills the ship, all with holes in their body from shrapnel.


"Garavan must have found the ship before we did. The Scairt put up a hell of a fight. They must have detonated the bridge to kill the Garavan, and themselves." Blaze says.


"Search for any survivors. Execute the Garavan on sight. If you see Scairt, assist them."


Suddenly, a Thar'Garavan ship drops out of a wormhole space. Your Leviathan defense ships quickly move into a defensive position, but the Thar'Garavan ship doesn't open fire.


"Sir! They're trying to hail us on our radio!"


You grab the radio, and turn it on.


"Greetings, Human Captain. I am Lesser Chief Dom. This ship is ours for scavenge. Our scavengers found it."


"You massacred the people on board."


"They opened fire on our greeting party, and attempted to attack our ship. It was in self defense. Please turn over the ship to us."
page 460:
You are General Achilles. Humanity has long left Earth, and went to the stars in a massive fleet. the Fleet consists of a half dozen Titan Ships, capable of holding an immense population the size of nations, with massive farms, water recycling planets, power stations,  and everything that could be required for human life to prosper. You've recently been promoted to General and a member of the Council, and are now not only in charge of military operations, but politics. Humanity has discovered many new species, including the Garavan, the many species who make up the Alliance, and the Remnants, Chosen and Tarn, who've formed a Coalition with you, as well as the Clones. Is there anything you want to learn about, or would you like to start?


(The Stats ALLIANCE and GARAVAN are for reputation and relationship among the Garavan Species and the Alliance. STRENGTH is the strength of the human fleet. UNITY is the unity of the Coalition between Humanity, the Remnants, the Clones, Chosen and Tarn.)
